item.title: Pavement tiles come loose, 18th August
item.description:

item.title: No loo seat, 18th August

item.title: Corner of barker drive and camley street, 18th August
item.description:
The bollard has been removed for many many months now which means that what should not be a through road has become a through road and it therefore increases the traffic in the area which puts children at risk

item.title: Huge amount of rubbish everywhere on the floor., 18th August
item.description:
The council has not emptied these bins for a number of weeks. This has caused the entire road to smell of rubbish/sewage due to the strong heat and overflowing bins. The bins were finally emptied this morning and now there is rubbish all over streets..

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eagle Wharf Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Sane oroblem FixMyStreet ref: 7794257, 18th August
item.description:
This still has not been resolved. Also on your website there was a previous issue reported of a blockage in front of house 26. 26 NOT 28 ! That might explain why any works at all were done in front of house 28 which NEVER had and issue with drainage problems in the last 20 years. The work team came to the WRONG house, to 28 instead of 26, and dug up the WRONG drainage and messed up the whole area and left cement all over the place. The new drainage looks like its been there for years, full of cement. Instead of fixing draining in front of house 26 they went and did a mess in front of house number 28's drainage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5-9, Sussex Mews East, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, drivers side window smashed, 18th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree planting request outside 38 MAYFIELD AVENUE, ORPINGTON, 18th August
item.description:
Last year, during trees planting season, the council had missed planting a replacement tree outside no: 38 MAYFIELD AVENUE, ORPINGTON BR6 0AL after a diseased tree was removed by the council a year earlier. We'd like to have a tree identical to the one outside the white house at no: 54 MAYFIELD AVENUE, ORPRINGTON, or Betula utilis jacquemontii - West Himalayan Birch tree. The replacement tree has been missing at least two years now. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
